PP-6353: Get metric registry from the environment

This is the proper way to get a reference to the metric registry. Data won't be
sent to hosted graphite otherwise.

commits.message:
BAU fix flakey stripe resource authorize integration test

we got this error:

"[ERROR]   StripeResourceAuthorizeIT.shouldCaptureCardPayment_IfChargeWasPreviouslyAuthorised:258->assertFrontendChargeStatusIs:278 1 expectation failed.
JSON path status doesn't match.
Expected: is ""CAPTURE APPROVED""
  Actual: CAPTURE READY"	Yes	Queue race condition	"The assertion is checking the state of the charge using connector's synchronous API.

Hypothesis is that there's a race condition in the assertion with respect to the background queue check. We are checking that the charge is in ""CAPTURE APPROVED"" state. However the charge has advanced onward into ""CAPTURE READY"" state. This implies that the background capture process has already picked up and started attempting to process the capture operation on the charge. "

With @oswaldquek

Merge pull request #2466 from alphagov/BAU-fix-flakey-stripe-resource-authorize-it-test

BAU fix flakey stripe resource authorize integration test

pull_request.title: BAU fix flakey stripe resource authorize integration test
pull_request.body:
we got this error:

```
[ERROR]   StripeResourceAuthorizeIT.shouldCaptureCardPayment_IfChargeWasPreviouslyAuthorised:258->assertFrontendChargeStatusIs:278 1 expectation failed.
JSON path status doesn't match.
Expected: is "CAPTURE APPROVED"
  Actual: CAPTURE READY"	
```

Hypothesis is that there's a race condition in the assertion with respect to the background queue check. We are checking that the charge is in ""CAPTURE APPROVED"" state. However the charge has advanced onward into ""CAPTURE READY"" state. This implies that the background capture process has already picked up and started attempting to process the capture operation on the charge. "

With @oswaldquek

pull_request.title: BAU fix flakey stripe resource authorize integration test
pull_request.body:
we got this error:

"[ERROR]   StripeResourceAuthorizeIT.shouldCaptureCardPayment_IfChargeWasPreviouslyAuthorised:258->assertFrontendChargeStatusIs:278 1 expectation failed.
JSON path status doesn't match.
Expected: is ""CAPTURE APPROVED""
  Actual: CAPTURE READY"	Yes	Queue race condition	"The assertion is checking the state of the charge using connector's synchronous API.

Hypothesis is that there's a race condition in the assertion with respect to the background queue check. We are checking that the charge is in ""CAPTURE APPROVED"" state. However the charge has advanced onward into ""CAPTURE READY"" state. This implies that the background capture process has already picked up and started attempting to process the capture operation on the charge. "

With @oswaldquek

commits.message:
PP-6353: Log payment transition to hosted graphite

We want to be able to detect anomalous drops in successful live authorisations.
It is envisaged that we can do this by noticing trends in authorisation errors
and successes. However it is currently hard to see this in the way we send data
to hosted graphite (HG). For example, currently we have to drill into
`aggregates.production.connector.gateway-operations.worldpay.live.gatewa-account-id`
(which is fine) then into `authorise/authorise3ds`,
`without-billing-address/with-billing-address` which makes it difficult to
graph the data we want. This PR sends the states a payment goes into which will
help us graph the trends more easily. This is similar to what we send to splunk.

Merge pull request #2465 from alphagov/PP-6353-log-payment-transition-to-hg

PP-6353: Log payment transition to hosted graphite

pull_request.title: PP-6353: Log payment transition to hosted graphite
pull_request.body:
We want to be able to detect anomalous drops in successful live authorisations.
It is envisaged that we can do this by noticing trends in authorisation errors
and successes. However it is currently hard to see this in the way we send data
to hosted graphite (HG). For example, currently we have to drill into
`aggregates.production.connector.gateway-operations.worldpay.live.gatewa-account-id`
(which is fine) then into `authorise/authorise3ds`,
`without-billing-address/with-billing-address` which makes it difficult to
graph the data we want. This PR sends the states a payment goes into which will
help us graph the trends more easily. This is similar to what we send to splunk.

## WHAT YOU DID
_A brief description of the pull request:_

## How to test

- How should it be reviewed? 
- What feedback do you need? 
- If manual testing is needed, give suggested testing steps.

## Code review checklist

### Logging

- [ ] only emit log lines at ERROR level which require immediate attention from a support engineer. These will trigger a zendesk alert.

### Documentation

- [ ] Updated README.md for any of the following ?

* Introduced any new environment variables / removed existing environment variable
* Added new API / updated existing API definition

commits.message:
PP-6852 Treat `card_error` error type from Stripe  as REJECTED

- Currently we treat all 4xx error types as REJECTED, but it is only `card_error` type that is expected for payments rejected by card issuer.
  Rest of the 4xx error types (like api_error, rate_limit_error) are unexpected and should be treated as ERROR.

**Changes**
- Only `card_error` type is now treated as AUTHORISATION_REJECTED for 4xx status and rest of error types will be marked as AUTHORISATION_ERROR

- Also improved toString() representation for `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse`. It is current logged with default toString() method (which appears like `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse@36e182ac`) in the upstream which is not helpful.

Merge pull request #2464 from alphagov/pp_6852_categorise_stripe_errors

PP-6852 Categorise Stripe authorisation client error as REJECTED/ERROR

pull_request.title: PP-6852 Categorise Stripe authorisation client error as REJECTED/ERROR
pull_request.body:
## WHAT YOU DID
- Currently we treat all 4xx error types as REJECTED, but it is only `card_error` type that is expected for payments rejected by card issuer.
  Rest of the 4xx error types (like api_error, rate_limit_error) are unexpected and should be treated as ERROR.

**Changes** 
- Only `card_error` type is now treated as AUTHORISATION_REJECTED for 4xx status and rest of error types will be marked as AUTHORISATION_ERROR

- Also improved toString() representation for `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse`. It is current logged with default toString() method (which appears like `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse@36e182ac`) in the upstream which is not helpful.

pull_request.title: WIP Stripe auth handles non card errors
pull_request.body:
POST to Stripe authorisation will reject with `4xx` for both card
valid card declines and corrupt requests. All of the codes listed in
https://stripe.com/docs/api/errors have never fired other than
`card_error` and `validation_error` when there is a problem with the
Platform accounts.

By default we should therefore have immediate alerts around anything
that isn't being treated as a `card_error`, this case will usually
require us to intervene.

pull_request.title: PP-6852 Treat `card_error` error type from Stripe as REJECTED
pull_request.body:
## WHAT YOU DID
- Currently we treat all 4xx error types as REJECTED, but it is only `card_error` type that is expected for payments rejected by card issuer.
  Rest of the 4xx error types (like api_error, rate_limit_error) are unexpected and should be treated as ERROR.

**Changes** 
- Only `card_error` type is now treated as AUTHORISATION_REJECTED for 4xx status and rest of error types will be marked as AUTHORISATION_ERROR

- Also improved toString() representation for `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse`. It is current logged with default toString() method (which appears like `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse@36e182ac`) in the upstream which is not helpful.

commits.message:
PP-6852 Treat `card_error` error type from Stripe  as REJECTED

- Currently we treat all 4xx error types as REJECTED, but it is only `card_error` type that is expected for payments rejected by card issuer.
  Rest of the 4xx error types (like api_error, rate_limit_error) are unexpected and should be treated as ERROR.

**Changes**
- Only `card_error` type is now treated as AUTHORISATION_REJECTED for 4xx status and rest of error types will be marked as AUTHORISATION_ERROR

- Also improved toString() representation for `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse`. It is current logged with default toString() method (which appears like `StripeAuthorisationFailedResponse@36e182ac`) in the upstream which is not helpful.

BAU fix mvn verify

- The pom references the dropwizard-dependencies as a parent which
includes an execution rule for maven-dependency plugin:analyze-only
setting the failOnWarning to true (the default is false). This plugin
is run as part of the verify phase. We have undeclared transitive
dependencies so the analyze-only goal fails and consequently the build.

Merge pull request #2462 from alphagov/BAU-fix_mvn_verify

BAU fix mvn verify

pull_request.title: BAU fix mvn verify
pull_request.body:
## WHAT YOU DID
- The pom references the dropwizard-dependencies as a parent which includes an execution rule for maven-dependency plugin:analyze-only setting the failOnWarning to true (the default is false). This plugin is run as part of the verify phase. We have undeclared transitive dependencies so the analyze-only goal fails and consequently the build.

pull_request.title: Bump metrics-graphite from 4.1.10.1 to 4.1.11
pull_request.body:
Bumps [metrics-graphite](https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics) from 4.1.10.1 to 4.1.11.
Release notes

Sourced from metrics-graphite's releases.

v4.1.11

Dependency updates

  • Bump maven-bundle-plugin from 4.2.1 to 5.1.1 (#1617)
  • Bump mockito-core from 3.3.3 to 3.4.0 (#1616)
  • Bump mockito-core from 3.4.0 to 3.4.2 (#1619)

Improvements

  • Enable reproducible builds (#1589)
Commits
  • 6502994 [maven-release-plugin] prepare release v4.1.11
  • 0d07b3e Skip installation of non-artifact sub-modules in Maven
  • e817d57 Bump mockito-core from 3.4.0 to 3.4.2 (#1619)
  • e4133ec Add information about which versions are maintained to README
  • ee57970 Enable reproducible builds (#1589)
  • 7dab8a0 Bump maven-bundle-plugin from 4.2.1 to 5.1.1 (#1617)
  • 8d940c2 Bump mockito-core from 3.3.3 to 3.4.0 (#1616)
  • dec8e59 [maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
  • See full diff in compare view
